import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.ensemble import GradientBoostingRegressor
from sklearn.preprocessing import OneHotEncoder
from sklearn.compose import ColumnTransformer
from sklearn.pipeline import Pipeline
from sklearn.impute import SimpleImputer
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Separate features and target
X_train = train_df.drop(['Id', 'SalePrice'], axis=1)
y_train = train_df['SalePrice']

X_test = test_df.drop(['Id'], axis=1)

# Handle missing values
numeric_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns
categorical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns

# Impute numeric features with median
X_train[numeric_columns] = X_train[numeric_columns].fillna(X_train[numeric_columns].median())
X_test[numeric_columns] = X_test[numeric_columns].fillna(X_test[numeric_columns].median())

# Impute categorical features with mode
for col in categorical_columns:
    X_train[col] = X_train[col].fillna(X_train[col].mode()[0] if not X_train[col].mode().empty else 'Unknown')
    X_test[col] = X_test[col].fillna(X_test[col].mode()[0] if not X_test[col].mode().empty else 'Unknown')

# One-hot encode categorical variables
preprocessor = ColumnTransformer(
    transformers=[
        ('cat', OneHotEncoder(drop='first', handle_unknown='ignore'), categorical_columns)
    ],
    remainder='passthrough'
)

# Use Gradient Boosting for better performance on housing data
model = Pipeline([
    ('preprocessor', preprocessor),
    ('regressor', GradientBoostingRegressor(n_estimators=500, learning_rate=0.05, max_depth=6, random_state=42))
])

# Train the model
model.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Predict on test set
y_pred = model.predict(X_test)

# Create submission DataFrame
submission_df = pd.DataFrame({
